                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           ||
|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [computeRoutes](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.computeRoutes) | `computeRoutes(request)` **Parameters:** - `request`:[ComputeRoutesRequest](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest) **Return Value:** [Promise](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise)`<{` ` routes:`[Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[Route](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route)`> `optional`,` ` fallbackInfo:`[FallbackInfo](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#FallbackInfo)` `optional`,` ` geocodingResults:`[GeocodingResults](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#GeocodingResults)` `optional `}>` Returns the primary route along with optional alternate routes, given a set of terminal and intermediate waypoints. Note: This method requires that you specify a response field mask in the request by setting the[ComputeRoutesRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.fields)property. The value is a list of field paths. For example: - Field mask of all available fields:`fields: ['*']` - Field mask of Route-level duration, distance, and path:`fields: ['durationMillis', 'distanceMeters', 'path']` <br /> Use of the wildcard response field mask`fields: ['*']`is discouraged because: - Selecting only the fields that you need helps our server save computation cycles, allowing us to return the result to you with a lower latency. - Selecting only the fields that you need in your production job ensures stable latency performance. We might add more response fields in the future, and those new fields might require extra computation time. If you select all fields, or if you select all fields at the top level, then you might experience performance degradation because any new field we add will be automatically included in the response. - Selecting only the fields that you need results in a smaller response size, and thus a faster load over the network. |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       ### Properties                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       ||
|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [description](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.description)                                                   | **Type:** `string `optional A description of the route.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| [distanceMeters](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.distanceMeters)                                             | **Type:** `number `optional The travel distance of the route, in meters.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [durationMillis](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.durationMillis)                                             | **Type:** `number `optional The length of time needed to navigate the route in milliseconds. If you set[ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference)to`TRAFFIC_UNAWARE`, then this value is the same as[Route.staticDurationMillis](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.staticDurationMillis). If you set[ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference)to either`TRAFFIC_AWARE`or`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`, then this value is calculated taking traffic conditions into account. Note: If the duration exceeds 2\^53 milliseconds, then this value is`Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY`. |
| [legs](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.legs)                                                                 | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[RouteLeg](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RouteLeg)`> `optional A collection of legs (path segments between waypoints) that make up the route. Each leg corresponds to the trip between two non-`via`waypoints. For example: - A route with no intermediate waypoints has only one leg. - A route that includes one non-`via`intermediate waypoint has two legs. - A route that includes one`via`intermediate waypoint has one leg. The order of the legs matches the order of waypoints from`origin`to`intermediates`to`destination`.                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [localizedValues](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.localizedValues)                                           | **Type:** [RouteLocalizedValues](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RouteLocalizedValues)` `optional Text representations of properties of the[Route](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [optimizedIntermediateWaypointIndices](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.optimizedIntermediateWaypointIndices) | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<number> `optional If you set[ComputeRoutesRequest.optimizeWaypointOrder](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.optimizeWaypointOrder)to`true`, this field contains the optimized ordering of intermediate waypoints. Otherwise, this field is empty. The index starts with 0 for the first intermediate waypoint provided in the input. For example, if you give an input of: - Origin: LA - Intermediate waypoints: Dallas, Bangor, Phoenix - Destination: New York and the optimized intermediate waypoint order is Phoenix, Dallas, Bangor, then this field will be`[2, 0, 1]`.                                                                                                         |
| [path](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.path)                                                                 | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[LatLngAltitude](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngAltitude)`> `optional The list of[LatLngAltitude](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngAltitude)s of the route, which can be used to draw a route polyline. Granularity of the path can be controlled by setting[ComputeRoutesRequest.polylineQuality](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.polylineQuality).                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [polylineDetails](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.polylineDetails)                                           | **Type:** [PolylineDetails](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#PolylineDetails)` `optional Contains information about details along the path.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| [routeLabels](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.routeLabels)                                                   | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[RouteLabel](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RouteLabel)`> `optional Labels for the route that are useful to identify specific properties of to compare against others.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [routeToken](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.routeToken)                                                     | **Type:** `string `optional An opaque token that can be passed to Navigation SDK to reconstruct the route during navigation, and, in the event of rerouting, honor the original intention when the route was created. Treat this token as an opaque blob. Don't compare its value across requests as its value may change even if the service returns the exact same route. Note:`routeToken`is only available for requests that have set[ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference)to`TRAFFIC_AWARE`or`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`. It is not supported for requests that have`via`waypoints.                                                                                                                                                 |
| [speedPaths](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.speedPaths)                                                     | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[SpeedPath](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#SpeedPath)`> `optional Groupings of sections of the route path with their corresponding speed reading. For this field to be populated,[ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference)must be set to`TRAFFIC_AWARE`or`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`and[ComputeRoutesRequest.extraComputations](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.extraComputations)must include`TRAFFIC_ON_POLYLINE`.                                                                                                    |
| [staticDurationMillis](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.staticDurationMillis)                                 | **Type:** `number `optional The duration of traveling through the route without taking traffic conditions into consideration. Note: If the duration exceeds 2\^53 milliseconds, then this value is`Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [createPolylines](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.createPolylines)                             | `createPolylines([options])` **Parameters:** - `options`:[RoutePolylineOptions](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RoutePolylineOptions)` `optional **Return Value:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[Polyline](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/polygon#Polyline)`>` Creates polylines for the route based on the data available. Multi-modal polylines: - Requirements: - The`"path"`and`"legs"`fields must be requested in[ComputeRoutesRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.fields) - [ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode)must be set to`TRANSIT`. - Creates a polyline for each multi-modal route segment. Polylines are styled according to the segment travel mode and transit line data when available. Options can be passed in to alter the polyline style based on travel mode and transit line. <br /> Traffic polylines: - Requirements: - The`"path"`and`"travelAdvisory"`fields (or just`"speedPaths"`as a shorthand) must be requested in[ComputeRoutesRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.fields). - [ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.routingPreference)must be set to`TRAFFIC_AWARE`or`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`. - [ComputeRoutesRequest.extraComputations](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.extraComputations)must include`TRAFFIC_ON_POLYLINE`. - Creates a polyline for each route interval when the speed reading differs from the preceding interval. Polylines have default speed-based styling applied. Options can be passed in to alter the polyline style based on speed. <br /> Overall polyline: - Requirements: - The`"path"`or`"legs"`field must be requested in[ComputeRoutesRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.fields). - Creates a single polyline for the entire route with default styling applied. Options can be passed in to alter the polyline style based on the route travel mode. For further customization, create polylines directly using[Route.path](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.path)or[RouteLeg.path](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RouteLeg.path). |
| [createWaypointAdvancedMarkers](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.createWaypointAdvancedMarkers) | `createWaypointAdvancedMarkers([options])` **Parameters:** - `options`:[AdvancedMarkerElementOptions](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/advanced-markers#AdvancedMarkerElementOptions)`|(function(`[AdvancedMarkerElementOptions](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/advanced-markers#AdvancedMarkerElementOptions)`, `[WaypointMarkerDetails](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#WaypointMarkerDetails)`): `[AdvancedMarkerElementOptions](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/advanced-markers#AdvancedMarkerElementOptions)`) `optional **Return Value:** [Promise](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise)`<`[Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[AdvancedMarkerElement](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/advanced-markers#AdvancedMarkerElement)`>>` Creates markers for the route labeled 'A', 'B', 'C', etc. for each waypoint. Markers have default styling applied. Options can be passed in to alter the marker style based on the marker index or properties of the corresponding[RouteLeg](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RouteLeg). The[WaypointMarkerDetails.leg](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#WaypointMarkerDetails.leg)parameter will be undefined if the route has no legs. The`"legs"`field must be requested in[ComputeRoutesRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.fields)in order for intermediate waypoints to be included.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |

## [RoutingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RoutingPreference)constants

google.maps.routes`.`RoutingPreferenceconstants

In contrast to`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`, some optimizations are applied to significantly reduce latency.                   |
| [TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RoutingPreference.TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL) | Calculates the routes taking live traffic conditions into consideration, without applying most performance optimizations. Using this value produces the highest latency.                      |
| [TRAFFIC_UNAWARE](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RoutingPreference.TRAFFIC_UNAWARE)             | Computes routes without taking live traffic conditions into consideration. Suitable when traffic conditions don't matter or are not applicable. Using this value produces the lowest latency. |

| [location](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint.location)                          | **Type:** `string|`[LatLng](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLng)`|`[LatLngLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngLiteral)`|`[LatLngAltitudeLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngAltitudeLiteral)`|`[DirectionalLocationLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#DirectionalLocationLiteral)`|`[Place](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/place#Place) The location of the waypoint. A string may be an address, a[plus code](https://plus.codes), or a Place resource name.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [sideOfRoad](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint.sideOfRoad)` `optional           | **Type:** `boolean `optional Indicates that the location of this waypoint is meant to have a preference for the vehicle to stop at a particular side of road. When you set this value, the route will pass through the location so that the vehicle can stop at the side of road that the location is biased towards from the center of the road. This option works only for`DRIVING`and`TWO_WHEELER`[ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| [vehicleStopover](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint.vehicleStopover)` `optional | **Type:** `boolean `optional Indicates that the waypoint is meant for vehicles to stop at, where the intention is to either pickup or drop-off. When you set this value, the calculated route won't include non-`via`waypoints on roads that are unsuitable for pickup and drop-off. This option works only for`DRIVING`and`TWO_WHEELER`[ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.travelMode)and when the[Waypoint.location](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint.location)is not a`string`or a[Place](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/place#Place).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| [via](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint.via)` `optional                         | **Type:** `boolean `optional Marks this waypoint as a milestone rather a stopping point. For each non-`via`waypoint in the[ComputeRoutesRequest](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest),[Route.computeRoutes](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.computeRoutes)appends an entry to the[Route.legs](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.legs)array to provide the details for stopovers on that leg of the trip. Set this value to`true`when you want the route to pass through this waypoint without stopping over. Via waypoints don't cause an entry to be added to the[Route.legs](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Route.legs)array, but they do route the journey through the waypoint. Notes: - You can only set this value on waypoints that are intermediates. The request fails if you set this field on terminal waypoints. - If[ComputeRoutesRequest.optimizeWaypointOrder](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#ComputeRoutesRequest.optimizeWaypointOrder)is set to`true`, this field cannot be set to true; otherwise, the request fails. |

Note: This method requires that you specify a response field mask in the request by setting the[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.fields)property. The value is a list of field paths. For example: - Field mask of all available fields:`fields: ['*']` - Field mask of Route-level duration and distance:`fields: ['durationMillis', 'distanceMeters']` <br /> Use of the wildcard response field mask`fields: ['*']`is discouraged because: - Selecting only the fields that you need helps our server save computation cycles, allowing us to return the result to you with a lower latency. - Selecting only the fields that you need in your production job ensures stable latency performance. We might add more response fields in the future, and those new fields might require extra computation time. If you select all fields, or if you select all fields at the top level, then you might experience performance degradation because any new field we add will be automatically included in the response. - Selecting only the fields that you need results in a smaller response size, and thus a faster load over the network. |

## [ComputeRouteMatrixRequest](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest)interface

google.maps.routes`.`ComputeRouteMatrixRequestinterface

Request for a route matrix.

|                                                                                                                ### Properties                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               ||
|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [destinations](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.destinations)                      | **Type:** [Iterable](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Iteration_protocols#the_iterable_protocol)`<string|`[LatLng](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLng)`|`[LatLngLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngLiteral)`|`[LatLngAltitudeLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngAltitudeLiteral)`|`[DirectionalLocationLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#DirectionalLocationLiteral)`|`[Place](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/place#Place)`|`[Waypoint](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint)`>` Array of destinations, which determines the columns of the response matrix. A value passed as a string may be an address, a[plus code](https://plus.codes), or a Place resource name. Altitude values are not taken into consideration.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| [fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.fields)                                  | **Type:** [Iterable](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Iteration_protocols#the_iterable_protocol)`<string>` Collection of fields to be fetched. Specify`["*"]`for all fields.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [origins](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.origins)                                | **Type:** [Iterable](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Iteration_protocols#the_iterable_protocol)`<string|`[LatLng](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLng)`|`[LatLngLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngLiteral)`|`[LatLngAltitudeLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/coordinates#LatLngAltitudeLiteral)`|`[DirectionalLocationLiteral](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#DirectionalLocationLiteral)`|`[Place](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/place#Place)`|`[RouteMatrixOrigin](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#RouteMatrixOrigin)`|`[Waypoint](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#Waypoint)`>` Array of origins, which determines the rows of the response matrix. A value passed as a string may be an address, a[plus code](https://plus.codes), or a Place resource name. Altitude values are not taken into consideration. Several size restrictions apply to the cardinality of origins and destinations: - The total number of origins and destinations specified as`string`s or[Place](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/place#Place)s must be no greater than 50. - The product of the number of origins and the number of destinations must be no greater than 625. - The product of the number of origins and destinations must be no greater than 100 if[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.routingPreference)is set to`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`. - The product of the number of origins and destinations must be no greater than 100 if[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)is set to`TRANSIT`. |
| [arrivalTime](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.arrivalTime)` `optional             | **Type:** [Date](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date)` `optional The arrival time. Note: Can only be set when[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)is set to`TRANSIT`. You can specify either[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.departureTime](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.departureTime)or[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.arrivalTime](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.arrivalTime), but not both. Transit trips are available for up to 7 days in the past or 100 days in the future.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| [departureTime](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.departureTime)` `optional         | **Type:** [Date](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date)` `optional The departure time. If you don't set this value, then this value defaults to the time that you made the request. Note: You can only specify a time in the past when[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)is set to`TRANSIT`. Transit trips are available for up to 7 days in the past or 100 days in the future.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [extraComputations](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.extraComputations)` `optional | **Type:** [Iterable](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Iteration_protocols#the_iterable_protocol)`<`[ComputeRouteMatrixExtraComputation](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixExtraComputation)`> `optional A list of extra computations which may be used to complete the request. Note: These extra computations may return extra fields on the response. These extra fields must also be specified in[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.fields](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.fields)to be returned in the response.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| [language](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.language)` `optional                   | **Type:** `string `optional The BCP-47 language code, such as "en-US" or "sr-Latn". For more information, see[Unicode Locale Identifier](http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unicode_locale_identifier). See[Language Support](https://developers.google.com/maps/faq#languagesupport)for the list of supported languages. When you don't provide this value, the language is inferred from your Google Maps JavaScript API[localization settings](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/localization#Language). Otherwise, the language is inferred from the location of the first origin.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [region](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.region)` `optional                       | **Type:** `string `optional The region code, specified as a ccTLD ("top-level domain") two-character value. For more information see[Country code top-level domains](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Internet_top-level_domains#Country_code_top-level_domains). When you don't provide this value, the region is inferred from your Google Maps JavaScript API[localization settings](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/localization#Region). Otherwise, the region is inferred from the location of the first origin.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.routingPreference)` `optional | **Type:** [RoutingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#RoutingPreference)` `optional Specifies how to compute the route matrix. The server attempts to use the selected routing preference to compute the route matrix. If the routing preference results in an error or an extra long latency, an error is returned. You can specify this option only when[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)is`DRIVING`or`TWO_WHEELER`, otherwise the request fails.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| [trafficModel](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.trafficModel)` `optional           | **Type:** [TrafficModel](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#TrafficModel)` `optional Specifies the assumptions to use when calculating time in traffic. This setting affects the value returned in[RouteMatrixItem.durationMillis](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#RouteMatrixItem.durationMillis)which contains the predicted time in traffic based on historical averages.[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.trafficModel](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.trafficModel)is only available for requests that have set[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.routingPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.routingPreference)to`TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL`and[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)to`DRIVING`. Defaults to`BEST_GUESS`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| [transitPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.transitPreference)` `optional | **Type:** [TransitPreference](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route#TransitPreference)` `optional Specifies preferences that influence the route returned for`TRANSIT`routes. Note: Can only be specified when[ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)is set to`TRANSIT`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [travelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.travelMode)` `optional               | **Type:** [TravelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#TravelMode)` `optional Specifies the mode of transportation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| [units](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/route-matrix#ComputeRouteMatrixRequest.units)` `optional                         | **Type:** [UnitSystem](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#UnitSystem)` `optional Specifies the units of measure for the display fields. ## [DirectionsStatus](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus)constants

google.maps`.`DirectionsStatusconstants

The status returned by the`DirectionsService`on the completion of a call to`route()`. Specify these by value, or by using the constant's name. For example,`'OK'`or`google.maps.DirectionsStatus.OK`.

Access by calling`const {DirectionsStatus} = await google.maps.importLibrary("routes")`.  
See[Libraries in the Maps JavaScript API](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/libraries).

|                                                                                                                                                                                     ### Constants                                                                                                                                                                                     ||
|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [INVALID_REQUEST](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.INVALID_REQUEST)               | The`DirectionsRequest`provided was invalid.                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| [MAX_WAYPOINTS_EXCEEDED](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.MAX_WAYPOINTS_EXCEEDED) | Too many`DirectionsWaypoint`s were provided in the`DirectionsRequest`. See the[developer's guide](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/directions#UsageLimits)for the maximum number of waypoints allowed. |
| [NOT_FOUND](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.NOT_FOUND)                           | At least one of the origin, destination, or waypoints could not be geocoded.                                                                                                                                                      |
| [OK](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.OK)                                         | The response contains a valid`DirectionsResult`.                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [OVER_QUERY_LIMIT](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.OVER_QUERY_LIMIT)             | The webpage has gone over the requests limit in too short a period of time.                                                                                                                                                       |
| [REQUEST_DENIED](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.REQUEST_DENIED)                 | The webpage is not allowed to use the directions service.                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [UNKNOWN_ERROR](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.UNKNOWN_ERROR)                   | A directions request could not be processed due to a server error. The request may succeed if you try again.                                                                                                                      |
| [ZERO_RESULTS](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsStatus.ZERO_RESULTS)                     | No route could be found between the origin and destination.                                                                                                                                                                       |

## [DirectionsResult](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsResult)interface

google.maps`.`DirectionsResultinterface

The directions response retrieved from the directions server. You can render these using a[DirectionsRenderer](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsRenderer)or parse this object and render it yourself. You must display the warnings and copyrights as noted in the[Google Maps Platform Terms of Service](https://cloud.google.com/maps-platform/terms). Note that though this result is "JSON-like," it is not strictly JSON, as it indirectly includes`LatLng`objects.

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ### Properties                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ||
|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [request](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsResult.request)                                          | **Type:** [DirectionsRequest](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsRequest) The DirectionsRequest that yielded this result.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [routes](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsResult.routes)                                            | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[DirectionsRoute](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsRoute)`>` An array of`DirectionsRoute`s, each of which contains information about the legs and steps of which it is composed. There will only be one route unless the`DirectionsRequest`was made with`provideRouteAlternatives`set to`true`.                                                                           |
| [available_travel_modes](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsResult.available_travel_modes)` `optional | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[TravelMode](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#TravelMode)`> `optional Contains an array of available travel modes. This field is returned when a request specifies a travel mode and gets no results. The array contains the available travel modes in the countries of the given set of waypoints. This field is not returned if one or more of the waypoints are 'via waypoints'. |
| [geocoded_waypoints](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsResult.geocoded_waypoints)` `optional         | **Type:** [Array](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array)`<`[DirectionsGeocodedWaypoint](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsGeocodedWaypoint)`> `optional An array of`DirectionsGeocodedWaypoint`s, each of which contains information about the geocoding of origin, destination and waypoints.                                                                                                                                        |

## [DirectionsRenderer](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsRenderer)class

google.maps`.`DirectionsRendererclass

Renders directions obtained from the[DirectionsService](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/directions#DirectionsService).

This class extends[MVCObject](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/event#MVCObject).
